## SDQ vs AOSI

The comparison between the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and Autism Observation Scale for Infants (AOSI) is critical for research in child psychology. The SDQ focuses on common behavioural issues in 2-17 year-old children, while AOSI is an assessment tool for the presence or absence of autism in infants. The task of comparing these two instruments can be overwhelming and laborious due to the different focus areas and varying versions or languages. But thanks to Harmony, the comparison of SDQ vs AOSI can be streamlined using AI and natural language processing technology. Harmony applies advanced algorithms to match items from different questionnaires, significantly eliminating the subjectivity and time-consuming nature of manual harmonisation techniques. It's specially designed interface allows psychology researchers to seamlessly use instruments either from its database, or by uploading their own in the PDF format. In the context of SDQ vs AOSI, Harmony can provide a percentage match between each item in them, giving you a comprehensive comparison that would be difficult to achieve manually. Whether you're comparing SDQ vs AOSI in English or in other languages, Harmony is your ultimate companion for efficient harmonisation. The tool accommodates multiple languages, ensuring research isn't limited by language barriers. Furthermore, Harmony ensures comparisons are both within and across studies, offering a more extensive analysis for your research. Try out Harmony today, and make your SDQ vs AOSI comparison a breeze.

## Compare the items in SDQ and AOSI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and AOSI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just AOSI into Harmony</a> - compare AOSI with other instruments
